title: The cost price of 18 articles is equal to the selling price of 15 articles. What is the gain percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to given problem,The cost price of 18 articles is equal to the selling price of 15 articles. What is the gain percent?Let C & S denote respectively the cost-price & the sell-price of one article.From above mentioned data we get following relation,18*C = 15*Sor S = (18/15)*C = (6/5)*C = (1 + 1/5)*Cor S = (1 + 20/100)*C …… (1a)Therefore it is evident from (1a) thatthe gain percentage = 20% [Ans]
CP pf 18 articles = SP of 15 articles CPSP=1518>3 units  Profit % =315×100=20% Profit
Let SP of 1 article is x SP of 15 articles is 15x CP of 18 articles is 15x SP of 18 articles is 18x Gain is 18x - 15x = 3x Gain% = Gain/CP × 100 = 3x/15x × 100 = 20% Therefore gain% is 20%
Let C.P of 1 article = Rs1 C.P of 18 articles=Rs. 18 S.P of 15 articles =Rs.18 S.P of 1 article=18/15=Rs.1.20 Profit=Rs.1.20–1=o.20 Profit %=profit/C.P*100=0.20/1*100=20%
